website_summaries.verdict: We find these well made, with a clear design that makes them easy to read without having to take them off.
pros: Installation takes just a few minutes
Protects your knobs from kids and pets
Effective against accidental bumps and gas turn-ons
cons: They may hang down and rattle around more than others

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Had to reasurch instulation.
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot! My son has grabed the knobs and turned just the gas on without igniteing it so that gas was leaking out in our house, which is really dangerous. The knob covers make the kitchen a lot safer for him. To instal you have to remove the knob on the stove which took me a little bit to figure out because the are stuck on fairly tight and i didn't want to break my stove. I ended up you tubeing it. But it worked in the end. I included a picture to help others see how they are instaled
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but does not fit Samsung range.
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality latches and I'm sure they work well, but they don't fit our stove. We have an electric Samsung range and because the knobs are built into the round casings (instead of just being stuck onto the front panel) these covers do not fit. See photo for reference of the casings I am talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: These don't work on fat knobs
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit my range knobs. My knobs are too wide - see photo. If you have knobs like I do, these won't work. I have given them away.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Will ruin your Stainless Steel countertop
customer_reviews.text: Maybe stainless steel cooktops aren't as good as they used to be, but after only a couple months use of these covers I removed them to do some deep cleaning and found they scratched my cooktop. They do serve their purpose well and are easy to install and pop open when you need to use the burner. I would have gladly paid more for something that didn't ruin by cooktop. Buyer Beware! Since finding this out I have installed felt on the bottom of these to prevent further damage. New buyers may want to do this before first installing them.
customer_reviews.author: Believer

customer_reviews.title: Scratches cooktop
customer_reviews.text: These do the job, however, they have scratched my stainless steel cooktop so I’m disappointed. I would have put some sort of cushion between the stainless steel and knob covers. They should have some kind of thin rubber or heat resistant padding to avoid the hard plastic scratching the stainless steel. When my kids grow up and I don’t have to worry about them setting the house of fire, I’ll have a halo of scratches to remember these plastic covers. Safety is more important than aesthetics so if I have to choose between the kids setting the house in fire and the scratches, I choose the scratches. Photos are with and without knob covers.
customer_reviews.author: Alisarue

customer_reviews.title: Great idea in theory, but maybe our stove knobs aren't substantial enough?
customer_reviews.text: These covers are essentially a plastic dome that sits around the entire stove knob with a hole in the back where the knob attaches to the stove. Maybe the knobs on our GE stove are smaller than standard, or maybe where they attach to the stove is thinner than standard, but these covers sort of hang on the knobs loosely and have nothing to grip on to at the back. So when you pull at the covers, both the cover and the knob come off. I wonder if I should try some double sided tape to attach the cover to the area behind the knob, but the instructions don't mention having to use anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: Bigredgirl

customer_reviews.title: Stove Ignition Assistant!
customer_reviews.text: The product installs easily over your existing stove knobs, but unfortunately that’s the only positive thing about this item. Once installed, it’s very easy for your toddler to push the cover against the knob and then ignite the stove. In fact, it’s even easier to ignite the stove with the covers on than without them. This product should be marketed for senior citizens as a home assisting product to help ignite their stoves. Do not purchase unless you have a powerful ventilation system that can vent the smell of natural gas from an unignited burner out of your kitchen. Absolute junk. Take the knobs off instead and save yourself a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: What is peace of mind worth?
customer_reviews.text: I love these. We renovated our kitchen and bought all new appliances. Unfortunately when we reach to retrieve items from our cupboard apparently we lean into a knob on the stove and it turns on!!! We do not have youngsters or grandchildren yet but both my husband and I have done it several times. My friend told me about this solution and I had ordered them before our phone conversation was over!! I really just need the one so I’m saving the rest for my future grandchildren. It’s actually well designed and made of quality materials. Very simple to use, no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne C Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to open & close
customer_reviews.text: They fit nicely and are easy to install. However they are made of hard plastic and are very hard to open. You have to push down on a little section and it just doesn't open easily. Feels like I'm going to break it each time I open it. Also hard to close because it doesn't always synch with where it's supposed to snap in. Feels cheaply made. Since it is hard plastic it will scratch the stove with continual use. I'll put some double sided foam tape behind each one and give them a week to see if they work & don't break. If they don't work right, I'll be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Christalina

customer_reviews.title: Cat proof!  Gives me peace of mind if I'm not at home
customer_reviews.text: I actually didn't think of child proof products for my gas stove knobs. I don't have kids. One of my cats is very active and is always jumping all around on everything. I saw these on a Jackson Galaxy video. Immediately ordered them. They do the job. I have a GE range. I didn't need the 5th cover. I got the clear. I now feel as though my cats won't cause an explosion when I'm out of the house. Bonus that it keeps the knobs from getting dirty from grease and splatters. When they are open they hit the oven door which isn't a big deal. Just set the stove temp and close the cover if using the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B

customer_reviews.title: Serves purpose. Fits loose/moves around.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but are loose around the dial as others noted so they spin and move around, which seems strange, and could rub against the oven door handle. But, they do serve the purpose that I bought them for to protect from accidentally turning on the dials!! I can open them easily to turn on the burners as needed too. If they’re supposed to be adhered in one spot with dual sided tape then that should be included. Or if it is an intentional part of design that should be noted. I would still buy them again if needed as they serve the purpose I bought them for. The package of them arrived open.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Safety from confused elderly individuals...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my elderly parent.... gets easily confused and in the middle of several nights in the past. She has hooked up the stove ...wantig to heat up and cook a bit and then had gone to bed .....totally forgeting that she had not turned it off....then Yikes!! only for me to wake up in a cloud of heavy smoke throughout the house.....!!! Naturally, I bought these as I knew she would have a hard time with her arthritic hands in Manipulating them. It's been a God-sent and I've been sleeping better ever since. No more worries at nght....
customer_reviews.author: MIKKI  J. P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the stove with reachable igniters, the knob covers are large enough too
customer_reviews.text: Once my toddler was able to reach the ignition knobs on the stove we had to research these and buy and install asap! I ended up adding a few small pieces of double sided tape so the knob covers wouldn’t move around and it worked like a charm. I also love that these have a little trick to opening them to have to push down on the top for them to open and luckily my son hasn’t figured that piece out. They are also large enough To accommodate different sizes of knobs. Definitely buy because you don’t want your kid playing with the stove if igniters- that is what scared us the most!
customer_reviews.author: MssyNorX

customer_reviews.title: Large and loose, but they work
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to prevent our inquisitive 7-month-old kittens from jumping up and catching the knobs on the gas range. They do the job. The are, however, very large (presumably so they’ll fit any type of knob); they kind of dangle on our knobs. I was concerned that would mean they didn’t work, but they do—you can’t turn the knob without opening the protective cover. It snaps open easily enough for an adult (I doubt a small child could do it) and easily snaps closed. These will serve the purpose while we train the kittens away from the stove area.
customer_reviews.author: P Maines

customer_reviews.title: They work...but are poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: They absolutely work and do not allow accidental turning of knobs...but they are frustrating to deal with. The button requires two hands...one to hold in place so it doesn’t put pressure on the knob/stem and break them and one to push the button down. I also think that the more ergonomic way to orient the covers is with the button in the top...which makes the embossed logo on the clear plastic upside down which is infuriating. They serve a purpose and if that is all you want...they are great. But if you want functionality and good design...look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: faciltigre

customer_reviews.title: Just bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when my son was 10 months old (hes rather tall) He is now only 17 months and from the few times he has fooled with them while I wasnt looking or the heat from the oven they all open like a piece of cake. My son is not even 2, but he is the size of a 3 year old. But hes not particularly rough with them, like I said if I am watching he doesnt get away with touching them at all. Yet- now he can open every single one of them. Hes gotten better just knowing they're off limits but these are crap and I cant believe they have such good ratings.
customer_reviews.author: ceejay

customer_reviews.title: Heat-resistant and high quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, perfect, perfect for our Whirlpool stove! Our baby was pushing and turning the knobs, but she can't anymore. These prevent our knobs from being pushed in. And toddlers can't turn them because the plastic covers just spin. Make sure your knobs can come off so you can install. And make sure you don't have knobs that are deep/set-in. Ours are standard with plenty of space for the backing to fit. To use the stove you just open the lid and close when done. They are heat resistant! This is important. Don't buy cheap knock-offs that will melt when hot. Safety 1st is high quality. The plastic is thick and tough.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Laurain

customer_reviews.title: They do the job and can’t wait to take them off.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried at first because my son seemed even more drawn to the stove with them on. They are loose, so he can play with them. He pulled the whole knob off the first day. I definitely have to keep these closed at all times even while cooking, so they’re a pain to have. But, they were a necessity and were easy to install, and after about a month I’ve gotten used to them. He still spins them but we haven’t had anymore knob issues, and they aren’t the novelty they first were. More importantly I know he can’t turn on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa K.

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality, design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I'll keep them, honestly. They are not a snug fit for my stove, but I have plenty of 3M double-sided tape so that's worth losing half a star at most. What's more concerning is how loose the latch is. Two of the covers close securely and require a firm press on the release tab to open. The other three stay closed if you grab them, but if you TOUCH (not press, or press and pull) the release tab they pop right open. So all it would take is for a kid to grab them in just the right spot and they're useless.
customer_reviews.author: Myra OC

customer_reviews.title: This one is pretty good, including the quality.
customer_reviews.text: This one is pretty good, including the quality. Those quality were higher than I was expecting. It actually avoid the child away from the danger because they could not be opened by child. however, the switches of my home stove are on the table not on the wall so I discovered it couldn’t make much sense. I swear they are good, but I don’t need it due to my situation. I requested the return and got the refund already. The seller is very nice that gave me refund directly. Five stars! I would like to recommend to everyone who actually need them.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: My kid hates them
customer_reviews.text: I had to find a YouTube video to figure out how to get my knobs off the oven in order to install these but once I did, installing all 5 took, maybe, a minute and a half. At first kiddo liked to play with these. Then he realized they were covering the knobs that he REALLY likes to play with so now he's mad at me for covering the knobs. He keeps a close eye on the knobs - if I leave one of these covers open, he tries to sneakily make his way to the range to play with the knobs. Gosh I love that kid.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Easy Instal!
customer_reviews.text: Easily installed! Just pull the knobs off place the cover and slide the knob back on and close the product! I cooked the next morning after installing and it was easy to use the product fit well! Overall works for what i needed it for and i feel better! My toddler is three and doesnt have any interest in the stove, nor is he big enough to reach, constant supervision, but i cant help but feel like even if he has no interest now, accidents happen and id rather put some safety locks on then wait for a mistake to happen! but i highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Karla Smith

customer_reviews.title: Only work for young toddlers
customer_reviews.text: These are fine for young toddlers, but at 20 months, my son figured out how to open them consistently. He was also able to use the cover as leverage to pry the cover+stove knob off as one unit. So...I will say that they did work, just not as long as I expected them to. The good news is that at 20 months, he's getting pretty good at following instructions, just not yet 100% consistently. Thus, I wish they were designed to work a bit longer through the toddler years (specifically, a little harder to open). I think another 4 months would have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Caution - they break!
customer_reviews.text: We bought and installed these on our gas oven to prevent the dogs from accidentally hitting the knobs. In theory, they're great, in reality... not so much They break... EASILY. They hang down *just enough* that if you leave it open and go to close the oven door, it'll hit the cover and break it. Down three covers in about six months.. yes, partially my own stupid fault for not closing the cover before closing the oven door but sometimes you're in a rush trying to get dinner on and... **it happens!
customer_reviews.author: M. Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but not pleasing
customer_reviews.text: This product does the job, but the covers are not pleasing to look at once installed. The opening on the back is extra large, so the cover just rattles around the shaft. A smaller hole that would keep the cover more centered would have been better from an appearance point of view. Since the alternative is possibly blowing up the house, I'll live with it. While they definitely will thwart an accidental turning-on, an argument could be made that by somewhat obscuring the knobs from view, there is increased risk of not seeing that a knob has been turned/left on by an otherwise authorized operator of the appliance.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alfred Bloomington III

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It might the design of my stove but the covers are to wobbly. In order to get to the actual knob you sometimes need two hands. My grandson is able to pull the entire assembly off stove but, once again, that might be the stove's design. I opened the oven, when I was once baking something, and the entire thing got pulled off the stove. It jumped inside of the oven. Not fun trying to fish something out of the hot stove. Other that that we feel much safer now then before.
customer_reviews.author: Cotick Somick

customer_reviews.title: Melty and dangly
customer_reviews.text: I placed these on my gas stove. They don't stay fixed in anyway so they no just kind of hang on the knob. I thought they'd have some sort of adhesive to keep them in place, but they do not. Then the first time we baked, the 2 center knobs covers melted shut. Not sure how I'm going to get them off. luckily they're for burners we don't use often. That's definitely not enough heat resistance as we were only baking around 300.
customer_reviews.author: se123456789

customer_reviews.title: Work great on standard removable knobs
customer_reviews.text: These work great on the stardard removable knobs. If you have anything that is different, I recommend reading reviews first, viewing the posted pictures, and taking measurements. I bought these because my dog keeps accidentally turning the gas on when she's trying to sniff food on top of the counter or the stove. They work great for that purpose and I imagine they would work for children too since they were even a bit hard for me to open initially right after installation.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these covers as someone in the house - a person or a cat - has accidentally turned on a gas burner more than once. I needed something to keep that from happening, and amazingly, these do the trick. They are not the most beautiful kitchen gadgets, but in truth they are not so bad either. They are loose fitting, they spin and turn easily, which is okay, they open and close with appropriate effort, and they keep us all from bumping the nobs and turning on the gas. Win. Win!
customer_reviews.author: jgr2

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment quickly turned to Appreciation!
customer_reviews.text: When I first placed this onto my stove knobs, I was disappointed that the knobs were so big and loose (i didn't expect that). After many times walking past the stove into the laundryroom and brushing against the knobs, I came to appreciate that very same attribute! Prior to installing these (simple to do, open and close knob cover over existing knobs), I constantly had to check to be sure the gas wasn't accidently turned on (such a narrow walkway!). Now, months later, I not only don't need to check, but I don't even think about it! Peace of mind! Especially when I saw my visiting 2yo grandson on his tiptoes trying to play with the knobs. YES! purchase these!
customer_reviews.author: sappy

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I installed these on my Kitchen Aid stove and they seem to work well so far. The cover for the know which adjusts temperature doesn't quite close completely. I used double sided tape on all of the covers and it holds then in place well. These even clear the screws behind the knobs in the center. So far my 18 month old can't open these, with the exception of the temperature knob due to the issue mentioned above. Overall these work as intended. I do recommend using double sided tape to hold them in place for athletic and functional purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Keeps us safe from the dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after my dog turned the gas knob on while I was at work one night. They have done a great job of preventing him from trying to kill us since then! When I installed them I gave them a couple of spins and whacks to try to "accidentally" turn them on and they just spun without engaging the knob which was perfect. I was worried at first they would be hard to open and close for cooking but they are actually super easy and kind of fun to click open and closed.
customer_reviews.author: kbwils

customer_reviews.title: Big and bulky
customer_reviews.text: I just got these yesterday... I wish these came in a four pack but I guess it doesn’t hurt to have another spare. I haven’t experienced any issues with heat resistance and they seem to do their job for keeping it out of reach for kids. My biggest issue is how BULKY they are. My sleek and updated stove now looks a little silly but I guess that shouldn’t matter since safety first. I just wish it was esthetically more pleasing to the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: GThiel

customer_reviews.title: They do the job but are uncomfortable for adults to open
customer_reviews.text: They do the job of stopping little ones from turning the knobs on but they are difficult (uncomfortable) to open for adults. You have to press hard to open them. They are also jiggly, they do not stay in place ( Its hard to explain , I added a video) . They could have been designed a little better. If you do not mind having to press a little hard to get them open then go ahead and purchase them, they do the job of keeping little ones safe.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Husband proof!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. We just bought a new house and it has a flat stove in the middle of our counter right across from the fridge. Twice! My husband was getting food out of fridge and put on the stove and somehow turned it on, twice. Luckily nothing happened. But, with having a toddler as well I bought these that night. They are easy to install, took me 30 seconds. And they are easy enough to use but keep it safe when they’re closed. Now if only my husband can turn on the right burner when cooking..... I’d buy again and recommend to everyone who sees them
customer_reviews.author: CandC

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit RV knobs!
customer_reviews.text: ::EDIT:: Went from 3 stars to 1. If I could give 0, I would. I was able to use these on my brand new black stainless slide in stove (since I could not use in the RV), and most of them broke within a month. Some lasted 2 months. ALL surfaces around knob were scratched from them. Don't waste your money! Ok well, these don't for RV stove knobs, so I can only rate them based off that. They said universal, so I was disappointed that these were to big to use. Will keep searching.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Great for dangerous toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: These are probably literal life savers. Our toddler LOVES the darn knobs to our gas stove. We have a gate to keep him out of the kitchen but when he slips in he goes straight for the fridge or stove knobs. These fit perfectly over our type of stove knobs so he can hit and twist the covers however he wants without adjusting the knobs. Of course caution should still be used with toddlers around appliances but these will definitely delay any danger. I will also advise getting the clear if you wish to cook with these closed so you can still see the knob.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Possible faulty?
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to install and operate...the latter of which could be my downfall. Either I have a genius child who is barely two and can open the knob protector or there is a fault in the design. I just bought this so will have to observe a little bit more before confirming which one. Although slightly dangerous but if I have a genius child, maybe I won’t need to set up a 529 plan cuz you know, that scholarship would be mighty helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Jiahuana

customer_reviews.title: just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Our 1 yr old has been very curious about the knobs on the stove so these were a must. For the price I was very happy and they fit our stove knobs perfectly. My only complaint with these is that they are a little hard to open (which I guess is the point but still). If they were a little more adult friendly I would give 5 stars for sure. Overall I would say if you have a curious little one these are great to have.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic melts when I bake
customer_reviews.text: These covered my knobs well. They don't stay right side up though. They flip around but stay closed and covered. My issue with this product is that if I was baking something, it would melt the plastic. Eventually the cover would fall off or break in half. I had to buy a new set. And then I gave up and just started taking my knobs off when not in use. Extremely helpful and childproof when in place though.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Can scratch the stove face plate
customer_reviews.text: Yes they do keep the kids from turning the knobs. Since the covers can spin while installed I did notice that they have scratched up the face plate of the stove where they rub. I should have put some felt on them or sticky taped them to the stove so they could not spin. The scratches will not be noticeable till you no longer need them for the kids. *note* If you have a stove that requires you to broil with the front door open you will melt these within a few mins. They are fine for normal use of opening up the door and checking the temp of what you are cooking but beyond that they will melt.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Pankratz

customer_reviews.title: Baby promptly unlocked them :)
customer_reviews.text: These guards install over the stove knob (you remove the knob, put the guard around it, and then put it back on the stove all together). my 18 month old pulled up a stool and promptly figured out how to open them... and was also able to just grab the guard and yank the whole knob off the stove. The quality is good and they are good for adults to navigate. It might just be my Trouble with a Capital T baby, and these might be better protection for other kids. I am leaving them on because they do slow him down at least :).
customer_reviews.author: Stapayr8485

customer_reviews.title: Great solution and good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Been installed for a while now, they work great! I installed them with heavy-duty mounting tape so they don't spin. That's worked great for us. The push-in safety knobs that didn't work now cannot be accidentally turned ON unless someone unlocks the caps and purposefully turns the knobs. Great solution! The closing clasp still snaps shut and it doesn't feel like it's being worn down. The plastic is hard, not flimsy. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for stoves with curious cats arround!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 cats adopted from a shelter and one is street smart but the other is not... The goofier cat would jump on our stove sometimes when food was not on it, and that worried us about if he would play with the nobs when we weren't home. This was an easy solution to cover the nobs. I am sure it can also work great to protect stoves from kids playing with them or tall dogs bumping into them.
customer_reviews.author: GK Riv

customer_reviews.title: Stay safe. Easy install and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I do replace yearly but that’s because my 1 year old is a hulk smash and he eventually ripped the cover off of two knobs. It served its purpose very well the first year, so I bought these to replace my old ones. If I can get a year out of these, I’ll be more than pleased. I highly recommend these for parents with curious and innovative toddlers. Easy to use, too.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: A must have for homes with gas stoves and dogs
customer_reviews.text: We got these after my dog turned on the stove once by accident. We haven't had a problem since. I'm reading some reviews and seeing that kids seem to be smarter than these a lot of the time. I can't speak on how it works for kids, but you won't have a problem if you're getting these because of a pet. They're simple to use, they aren't an eyesore, and they were very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Sizing NOT universal
customer_reviews.text: If your range has anything behind it when you remove the knob (like a circular design jutting out), these likely will not work. Safety First fails to give dimensions on this product, nor any indication of what specific models it fits. That being said, I'm sure the product works great--if it fits.
customer_reviews.author: smoics

customer_reviews.title: Made operating knobs trickier on some
customer_reviews.text: On a couple of knobs it seems to stick and makes it harder to turn them, but it's doable. And they definitely serve the purpose of keeping the knobs from being pushed accidentally by kids/animals/us, they're deep enough that it can't be done no matter how hard you push. Another reviewer mentioned that it made it hard to open the oven since they hang, we didn't have that problem on ours, but I'm sure it will vary from model to model.
customer_reviews.author: stuff

customer_reviews.title: NOT child safe! Nothing to secure them in place
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like these covers at all. There isn’t anything to hold them in place so they just spin around the knobs. I’m not sure how they are supposed to be “child safe” when a child can pull on the plastic cover itself and remove both the cover and the gas stove knob at once! I’ll be returning these and looking for a set we had previously that included an adhesive circle to secure the covers in place.
customer_reviews.author: Weezie

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping our lab "puppy" from turning on the stove
customer_reviews.text: We tried several different items to stop the stove knobs from turning when our young lab jumped onto the stove, and nothing worked or were very inconvenient to cook. Then we saw these while visiting our friend's with an toddler a few months ago, and they work great. They prevent our dog from turning the knobs when she jumps, but also open easily so we can still utilize the stove without having to take them off. Really great product.
customer_reviews.author: V.Allen

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind at night with curious cat
customer_reviews.text: Our teenage cat loves to jump, and even though he's officially not allowed on countertops, he sees it differently--and seeing him bump a stove knob and accidentally turn on the gas once was enough! This was easy to install on our GE stove by just taking the knobs off (wow, it was dirty under there) and it just takes a bit of getting used to pushing the catch open when you want to use a burner.
customer_reviews.author: CKO

customer_reviews.title: Foster Care
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for Foster Care. We have a gas range and we were worried since you tap them and the gas can begin flowing. We are really grateful for these. It took only a few days to get used to using them. Now we feel we wouldn't go without them. It helps us be more aware of when we are using the stove and to turn everything off when we are completed. They were easily put on and I am able to clean around them well; they actually keep the knobs much cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: C&L Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Two Broke in under 4 Months - not safe!
customer_reviews.text: Two of the knobs just snapped off with minimal use in under 4 months. My daughter hasn't messed with them so they only get opened and closed occasionally. You can see I leave them open when she's not close. The first one snapped after a month or two and I thought it was a fluke. The second one just crumbled this week. Two of them falling apart in under four months of minimal use is horrible quality. I'd hate to think if these crumbled while a child was trying to access the oven controls. I wouldn't trust these to protect your knobs! ...better off just sticking your knobs in a drawer so the kiddo can't turn things on.
customer_reviews.author: Y M S

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Inexpensive and easy to install/remove. They’re a bit bigger than my stove knobs, but definitely get the job done. My 18 month old just started coming into the kitchen and spinning the stove knobs, which can be terribly dangerous both for us and our meals. I wanted to stop her from doing this before she really started to enjoy it. These knobs were super easy to install: just pop off your knobs, put the cover over the post, replace the knobs! Done! I got the clear ones so that I can still see the stove settings even with the cover closed. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: steel_muffinsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend if you are looking for peace of mind while ...
customer_reviews.text: I finally feel safe! Either my mother was knocking into the stove and setting the stove burners on, or one of my animals was. Either way, on several occasions I've come home to the smell of gas. These were a breeze to install. As another person wrote, the knobs get in the way of our oven door somewhat, but it's not an inconvenience and for the peace of mind of not having our home fill with gas from an unlit pilot light, it's not a problem at all. I would recommend if you are looking for peace of mind while you are away from home and have found a need for such safety as these stove knob covers.
customer_reviews.author: BlackberryMargarita

customer_reviews.title: Holds up pretty well!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these before and they held up pretty well up to 8 years until one of them actually came apart from the backing. The reason was that it rusted the hinges that's why when I pressed down to open it, it came apart. Could be from cleaning products, cooking oil, hot liquids spilling over. I'd say it was wear and tear. The other 3 that I had were still intact with a little rust but I just changed the whole set just to be on the safe side.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanna

customer_reviews.title: This is the second set of these I've ordered and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of these I've ordered and I just had to discard them again because the hinge pins are unsecured and eventually slip out, causing the cover to fall off. Should have learned my lesson the first time! I'll have to try to find another option.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great Knob Covers
customer_reviews.text: These knobs are great! All pros, no cons: - They are easy to install - Adults can still easily access the knobs - They look just fine (they're not ugly, I hardly notice them) - They are clear, so you can see through them to make sure the burners are off - And most importantly, they keep kids safe by making it impossible for kids to accidentally (or intentionally) turn on the burners. - they are easy to install, look just fine (not ugly), it's still easy enough for adults to access the knobs, but
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: My one year old pop them open right away!
customer_reviews.text: Very unsatisfied!!! These are very poor quality! My one year old learned how to open these for a day. They will not do 0 job on baby proofing our stove knobs. He just needed to learn how to squeeze them harder and voala! The plastic is so thin that the little tooth that is suppose to keep the closed is popping right up! Also there was no adhesive with them so I had to find something to stick them on place, otherwise they just move around all the time. One of the worst things I have ever bought. I would return them if I hadn't glued them on to the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Vyara Georgieva

customer_reviews.title: They work and are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old had learned to turn on our gas burners and turn them off. As any parent knows it is difficult to discipline a 1 year old from something like this because they cannot remember at this age. This was a hazard as he could turn on the gas without lighting a burner and allow gas to just flow into the house; not to mention other hazards. Now when we cook he even knows that these are supposed to be closed, so if we leave one open he will close it; he is 15 months old now so he closes and latches everything now. No matter what these were worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: PACowboy

customer_reviews.title: Necessary with a gas stove and a toddler!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. Our toddler is tall enough to reach the knobs on the stove and there have been a couple of times when we realized the gas was on. If we hadn't caught that, who knows what would have happened. He likes to help when we bake or cook and although we've expressed to him that he isn't allowed to touch the knobs if we aren't with him, he's still young and curious so now that we have these, I don't have to constantly check the stove. He hasn't figured out how to open them yet and that's awesome. We are very grateful for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nattie Berry

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - left scratches in my stainless steel range control panel.  Take of knobs instead.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but the plastic rotating against the stainless steel of the range controls leaves scratches. Turns out, I could also just remove the knobs from the range, so now I just take my knobs off and have thrown these in the trash. I'm left with permanent scratches in my stainless steel range control panel, which was brand new when these were put on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P.

customer_reviews.title: kinda floppy
customer_reviews.text: They do what i need them to do, however they rotate and flop all over. They are also pretty thick and stick out quite a ways from the stove. Much larger than they would need to be. I will probably remove them when the grandchildren are not visiting. The do not open all the way because my towel bar/oven door handle inhibits this, and so it is very cumbersome to have to turn the knob with a "half open" knob cover. Also the hole in the center that goes under the know is MUCH larger than it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Marie

customer_reviews.title: Decent idea, really stupid execution
customer_reviews.text: So, you literally just pull off your stove knobs, and push them back on with the back of this cover between the stove and the knob. The result is, these covers just flop around. They completely lack anything to secure them to the stove. I'm keeping them, and I'm going to add some double sided tape or something to attach them to the stove. This really just seems like a giant oversight though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The dog has stopped turning on the stove
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas stove, a brother with autism and a Grayson. I arrived home to fire alarms beeping brains out, smoke all over house and a stove fire. Grayson had turned on the stove, set fire to the "do not leave cereal boxes on the stove again". My brother slept through it. These were easy to put on, easy to open when stove is needed and I feel better.
customer_reviews.author: Tory Eastman

customer_reviews.title: NOT for LG stove
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit the new LG stoves (Purchased new 11/2019) whose knobs turn on extremely easily. I totally regret buying this stove as within two months 2 potholders have caught on fire by the stove being accidentally turned on. I hope I can find safety knobs to fit as LG will not allow me to return the stove to Home Depot for a refund. Home Depot will not accept the return without LG permission!
customer_reviews.author: lv2bgrandma

customer_reviews.title: Break easily
customer_reviews.text: They break kind of easily. About 10 months ago the first one broke and now tonight a second one broke. We aren’t rough. Just open and close them like anyone would. We bought them March 2018 and now it’s September 2020. So I guess after two plus years it’s bound to happen but still a little frustrating. Other than that, they have been good.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B.

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit KitchenAid Stove.
customer_reviews.text: Good product but unfortunately it doesnt fit our stove. We have a KitchenAid (see pics below), and if you remove the knobs to fit the protectors, there is a base on the back of the knob so you will never be able to pass that and fit your knobs back in completely.
customer_reviews.author: jamile

customer_reviews.title: Works well to keep the stove from accidentally being turned on
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for use with the puppy while training to not counter surf. Here's big enough to accidentally turn the knobs on the front of the store, so we wanted something to prevent that. Easy to install & easy enough to access the knobs when needed. I like that it's clear to be able to easily see the knob settings at a glance.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F.

customer_reviews.title: Seems like its easy to be broken and easy to fall off the the children pull on it
customer_reviews.text: I like this product & surprisingly my 2 year old hasnt figured out how to open it yet because he figured out how to open the kitchen cabinet locks. The good thing about the case is that you have to press down hard i try not to open it infront of him if he pulls off the case the whole knob comes off and theres no way for him to be turning on the stove. Very easy to install just take off the knob but the case first and the knob on top .
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easy. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these because the knobs on our stove are very sensitive. Just brushing past them turns them on and its a gas stove. They were great at first. Easy to install and use. Then one by one the hinges started to break. Now I am down to 2 and am worried that the gas will accidentally get turned on again. These must be cheaply made or not for daily use. I would not buy them again. I should mention that they are less than a year old.
customer_reviews.author: Marc and Dori Durbin

customer_reviews.title: Works well, so far deterring our pyro kitty
customer_reviews.text: We've had these for about two months and so far they are great. Easy to install, do what they are supposed to. It's not much of a hassle to deal with them while cooking on our gas stove, they open easily for adults. You can leave them open while actively using the burner for easy adjustments and close them when unattended. I can't speak to how they work with children, but we got these after our cat turned on the pilot while we weren't home and almost burned down our apartment. We have no idea how she did it so we got these as a precaution. So far very kitty-proof.
customer_reviews.author: Martin W. Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Needed 6 instead, so sent back. Didn't see adhesive...
customer_reviews.text: Uh... I didn't find adhesion with them. They just sat loose on the buttons. I was initially happy but then I needed one more, so I ended up sending them back and ordering one with adhesion and 6 button covers. No real complaints since we didn't fully use them. If there is adhesive, then they would be much better than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I had these before, but they got lost in the move and I had to wait for a price drop. Well, it did and I am so glad I got them. They feel so much sturdier than other guards, especially important if you use your stove alot and have to open and close them frequently. The guards also gives a noticeable "click" when you lock it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it..
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what adhesion is for since there is nothing to adhere. Anywaz..we bought these for our camper stove cause when we reached over the stove the knob was always getting turned on and propane was setting off the detector. These work great..are easy to install..and easy to open up and use stove knobs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat-proofing
customer_reviews.text: After moving to a new apartment, I quickly learned that the gas range knobs were much, much, MUCH more easily turned on than at our last place. How? Well, this furry little hell beast turned on the range. Twice. Normally, I would not say my cat is out to gas us all into oblivion. But two times? I ordered these knob covers, and now we're safe from his nefarious ways. At least, when it comes to the range...
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Stengel

customer_reviews.title: A Worthy Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: These knob covers are perfect for our gas stove. We have a two year old, who loves to be independent and recently, she’s been trying to cook like mommy and daddy. She has a play kitchen, but that’s not quite the real thing. I knew that we needed to do something different when I caught her playing with the knobs on our stove. These have completely prevented her from trying to turn on the gas burners. They’re definitely worth it for the peace of mind that they provide!
customer_reviews.author: Terelle Snook

customer_reviews.title: Not for LG
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our LG double oven - because our dog has turned on the stove more than once. They barely fit, but they do the trick to keep the dog from setting the house on fire. I have to remove them to cook most of the time. If my toddler had any interest in the stove, we'd have to get different knobs.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Luciano

customer_reviews.title: Great for CATS that put the gas on!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because one day my cat decided to put our gas stove on. Scared the life out of me so I decided to try these, they work great. I don't know about kids, no kids in my household but if you need it for your cats then buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well so far. My very curious 1 year old found the knobs so I knew it was time to make sure they were covered so she couldn't accidentally turn on the gas. Just pulled the knobs off, put this on and put the knob back on. I bought 2 sets. One for our house and one for our camper. These didn't fit the camper ones unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: karapg

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and User-Friendly
customer_reviews.text: These covers are inconspicuous, wipe down easily, and (so far) the plastic doesn’t cloud after multiple disinfectant wipe downs. They’re simple for an adult to open but not for a child, just make sure you actually click them closed when you’re done with the burner. My only concern would be that they seem a little brittle. They would probably break if you squeezed too hard while trying to open it or dropped a heavy pan on it but that would happen with pretty much any cover.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. They work well. Easy to clean. Does the job intended perfectly. I bought because my dog turned the gas stove on when she jumped to try to get pizza. Bought the same night and haven’t had any problems since. Perfect because my 9 month old is starting to reach for things as well and this will stop him from accessing the knobs.
customer_reviews.author: angela borggreen

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: was at first happy that they fit our vintage wedgewood stove, however about 2 second of having them on, my 17 month old walk right up to these and opened them without any struggle. What in the world is the point of these if they are that easy to open!?!?!! They also make it very easy for my 17month old to pop of the knobs. These are a bigger headache than nothing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mommypop

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: We kept accidentally turning the gas stove on, which is a really stupid and deadly mistake, because I am too short to reach things without leaning against it and when I do, it turns the knobs. This perfectly prevents my accidentally detonating my house like a baby or cat, which apparently also put you at risk for this, though my cats didn't. Just me. The human adult. Took seconds to snap on and don't get in the way at all except how you want them too. Worth the price to not blow up my apartment building.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen R

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: We actually got these so my dog wouldn’t hit the knobs while we were out if the house. we love them and have recommended them to our builder to install on all the new houses here. They are bulky but once up no one really notices them because they are clear. For cooking we just snap the cover and let it hang, or close it if we are using the stove for a longer period of time. We love this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but poor quality, won't last long
customer_reviews.text: These lasted us less than a year. Installed them July 2017 and by the end of March 2018 two had broken off at the hinge necessitating the purchase of another set. We are trying a different brand this time, but they all seem to be made similarly and with the daily opening and closing of the covers to use the stove, it seems that they just won't last very long. Cheaply made. But we have to keep our toddler from burning herself or our house down, so we'll keep buying more.
customer_reviews.author: gilad cohen

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit tight!!!
customer_reviews.text: They do not fit the knob on the stove! I do not have young children, or grandchildren. That wasn't the reason I purchased them, however when you lean on the stove reaching for something the stove will come on. These are not good at all, because they turn all the way around after you have installed them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Slate

customer_reviews.title: So helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to prevent accidentally turning on my stove, since my new one has really loose controls. These covers were easy to install and are convenient for actually using the knobs when cooking. Even though I don't have kids, would 100%recommend for child proofing as my niece (18 months) can't overcome them.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer1643

customer_reviews.title: Fits and works on my GE Profile
customer_reviews.text: Go figure, I didn’t need to buy these until child number four. There were several times we came home to the smell of propane because our one-year-old had turned the stove knob on unknowingly to us. I ordered these, and they installed on my GE profile oven in about 15 seconds. It’s been several months, and she hasn’t figured them out. In fact, she gave up after a few days. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: C. Netland

customer_reviews.title: Far from "Universal Fit"
customer_reviews.text: Be warned: these will not work on many ranges. The covers have to go behind the knobs. So this means (a) you have to take the knobs off to install the covers--be sure you can do this on your oven range. (b) Your knobs cannot be recessed, or else the covers can't fit behind the knob to be installed. See photo of the type of range that will NOT work, as the knob is recessed into the panel. There has to be space between the knob and the panel of the oven, i.e. the knob has to be floating out 1/4" or so.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Hot to touch with gas stoves
customer_reviews.text: These work okay at first, but due to having a gas stove they become very hot to the touch. We've only had them 9 months and at least 3 of them have broken to the point they don't want to open or they won't stay closed. My children don't touch them so they aren't breaking them. They just don't have a very long "wear and tear" life span.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Williams

customer_reviews.title: I've been very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with these. It seems model of oven matters as far as melting (based on other reviews) and you just have to see how it works with yours. I've broiled with the door open plenty and I cook at pretty high oven temperatures often with no problems whatsoever. *As with any baby safety product you still have to actually watch your children. I don't leave my little ones alone with an oven in the room but these will slow them down when I've looked away for a minute.*
customer_reviews.author: Mommahov

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for stove safety
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed with two toddlers in the house. They are perfect for preventing my kids from trying to turn the knobs. The only negative is that the don’t stick. So they will hang down and hit the oven door when you open it, and spin freely. I have used adhesive to secure them into place which has now solved that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a must have for kids that can reach the stove
customer_reviews.text: We recently had our son decide he wanted to play with the stove knobs, luckily we had a close eye on him and saw him do it so we could immediately turn it off. Otherwise this could have been extremely dangerous for all of us. Definite must have - prevents the kids from being able to turn the knobs so easy. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: Justin A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for obnoxious pups too.
customer_reviews.text: These I bought because we have a full size Aussie who almost grown. Ever since his pup brother went to heaven he has been putting his paws on the stove. I was terrified he would turn it on, as our GE glass top slide in stove nobs on the electric range can be bumped and turned on. These give me piece of mine, and after two weeks of mourning he stopped doing it, but these are staying on.
customer_reviews.author: Karwyn

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: These did not fit my gas stove. They only work if the knob comes off of the stove. It really needs a slit in the back side so that it will slide on the knob. Gave to an aunt who has an electric stove, and she had the same problem. This brand is normally great, it’s just the design of this product that i was disappointed in.
customer_reviews.author: italian_mom816

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply, but need a little tweaking in design...
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to apply and open, but because they dangle from the stove knobs once attached, I think they need to also come with some adhesive backing... If I mess with them enough, the dangling covers are able to turn the stove knobs a little, which kind of defeats the purpose...
customer_reviews.author: Lisa T.

customer_reviews.title: Fragile plastic hinge, no adhesive backing whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: This thing came with no adhesive backing whatsoever. I ended buying a pack of two-sided adhesive tape and using it to stick the base behind the knob. The worst part is that it barely lasted a month, with heavy use. The cheap plastic base gave up and cracked near its hinge, letting go of the cap and its holding pin. All five units are now broken and useless. I’d not recommend this product if you use your stove top frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Nice stove knobs
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to keep the children and the dogs away from the stove knobs. These work great. They were easy to put on and easy to open up when we are ready to use the stove. Our daughter has tried to turn them a few times, but we just try to distract her before she starts putting too much energy into figuring out how to open them. Since they are clear they are not too noticeable on the stove and because they are plastic they are easy to clean if some food splatters on them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. I’m not sure if my stove knobs are on the smaller side or what, but these weren’t tight at all and just rely on the knob to keep them on. There’s no adhesive or anything to make them stick to the stove, so my 13 month old was able to reach up and pull them, with the knob, off. I don’t recommend them at all.
customer_reviews.author: branjess20510

product_meta.title: Safety 1st Child Proof Clear View Stove Knob Covers (Set of 5)
product_meta.description:
Size:5 CountKeep curious kids away from dangerous stove knobs with Safety 1st Child Proof Clear View Stove Knob Covers. These clear plastic covers install easily and fit over your stove knobs to keep children from turning them. Simply pop open the cover's hinged lid to access the knob when it's time to cook. Easily confirm whether a stove burner is on or off with the stove safety knob cover's clear, see-through lids. These stove knob covers are made from durable, heat-resistant plastic to resist wear and hold up to repeated use. Featuring a universal design, these plastic safety stove knob covers are oversized to fit the knobs of most modern appliances. This set includes five stove knob covers. Safety 1st Child Proof Clear View Stove Knob Covers are for indoor use only. Safety 1st believes parenting should have fewer worries and more joyful moments. As the first and only leader in child safety, Safety 1st is here to give you peace of mind so you can spend less time worrying and more time enjoying every first you experience with your child. Before using broiler,completely remove stove knob covers to prevent damage from heat. To access stove knob, press back grip tab and lift cover.
